total_revenue.context: Q4 2022 net sales increased to $149.2 billion, up 9% year-over-year. Excluding the $5.0 billion unfavorable impact from foreign exchange rates, net sales grew by 12% compared to Q4 2021.
total_revenue.fx_impact: Foreign exchange rates had an unfavorable impact of $5.0 billion on net sales growth.

net_sales.context: North America net sales increased to $93.4 billion, up 13% year-over-year, or 14% excluding foreign exchange rates.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for North America increased to $93.603 billion, up 13% year-over-year.

operating_income.context: Operating income for North America decreased to -$0.240 billion in Q4 2022, compared with -$0.206 billion in Q4 2021.

net_sales.context: International net sales decreased to $34.5 billion, down 8% year-over-year, or increased by 5% excluding foreign exchange rates.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for International decreased to $36.691 billion, down 5% year-over-year.

operating_income.context: Operating income for International decreased to -$2.228 billion in Q4 2022, compared with -$1.627 billion in Q4 2021.

net_sales.context: AWS net sales increased to $21.378 billion, up 20% year-over-year.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for AWS increased to $17.780 billion, up 20% year-over-year.

operating_income.context: Operating income for AWS decreased to $5.205 billion in Q4 2022, compared with $5.293 billion in Q4 2021.

net_sales.context: Consolidated net sales increased to $149.2 billion, up 9% year-over-year.

operating_expenses.context: Consolidated operating expenses increased to $146.467 billion, up 9% year-over-year.

operating_income.context: Consolidated operating income decreased to $2.737 billion in Q4 2022, compared with $3.460 billion in Q4 2021.

total_expenses.context: Consolidated operating expenses for Q4 2022 were $146.467 billion, up 9% from $133.952 billion in Q4 2021.
key_factors: Expanded marketing and general administrative expenses

COGS.context: Cost of goods sold increased to $208 million in Q4 2022.

Fulfillment.context: Fulfillment expenses increased to $757 million in Q4 2022.

Technology_and_content.context: Technology and content expenses increased to $3.126 billion in Q4 2022.

Sales_and_marketing.context: Sales and marketing expenses increased to $1.092 billion in Q4 2022.

General_and_administrative.context: General and administrative expenses increased to $423 million in Q4 2022.

Other.context: WW shipping costs increased to $24.714 billion in Q4 2022.

Stock_based_Compensation.context: Total stock-based compensation expense increased to $3.680 billion in Q4 2022.

operating_income.context: Consolidated operating income decreased to $2.737 billion in Q4 2022, compared with $3.460 billion in Q4 2021.

net_income.context: Net income decreased to $0.3 billion in Q4 2022, compared with $14.3 billion in Q4 2021.

eps.context: Net income of $0.3 billion translates to $0.03 per diluted share in Q4 2022, compared with $1.39 per diluted share in Q4 2021.

free_cash_flow.context: Free cash flow decreased to an outflow of $11.6 billion for the trailing twelve months, compared with an outflow of $9.1 billion the previous year.

operating_cash_flow.context: Operating cash flow increased by 1% to $46.8 billion for the trailing twelve months.

free_cash_flow_less_principal_repayments.context: Free cash flow less principal repayments of finance leases and financing obligations increased to an outflow of $19.8 billion for the trailing twelve months, compared with an outflow of $20.4 billion the previous year.

free_cash_flow_less_equipment_and_other_.context: Free cash flow less equipment finance leases and principal repayments of all other finance leases and financing obligations increased to an outflow of $12.8 billion for the trailing twelve months, compared with an outflow of $14.3 billion the previous year.

total_employees.context: Employees (full-time and part-time; excludes contractors & temporary personnel) decreased to 1,541,000 in Q4 2022, down 4% year-over-year.

market_position.description: Amazon continues to lead in various sectors including e-commerce, cloud computing, digital streaming, and innovative technologies.

leadership_transition.description: Jeff Bezos, Amazon founder and CEO, transitioned to the role of Executive Chair in Q3 2021, and Andy Jassy became Chief Executive Officer at that time.
leadership_transition.context: Jeff Bezos stepped down to focus on long-term strategic initiatives and innovation, while Andy Jassy, head of AWS, took over as CEO to lead Amazon's continued growth.
